title: HeLiS: An Ontology For Supporting Healthy Lifestyles
segmentation: So good morning, my name is Jamal Gonyon dimer searches scientist at Funderburk Kessler Research Center located in Trento, Italy and this morning I present the work that I jointly done with my colleagues in FBC concerning the creation of Harris that is an ontology for supporting healthy lifestyles and this person.

Addition is the first act of our health saga that we present this year at the SWC, because this afternoon we will present our newspaper, integrating Alice into our real wood platform, and this evening during the post and demo session you can visit us for visiting our demo of our platform.
So what?

Is at least briefly, Alyssa is a resource that includes the two kind of information concerning health, health care domain information about food than physical activities domain and what we called sort of monitoring knowledge that consists of concepts that can be used for supporting monitoring activities concerning the behaviors of users using applications in which Alice is integrated.
So why we?

Get up there and other resources and other issues about food domain, for example because we when we submit the literature, there are already many available resources about this topic that has been presented and published.
However, when we look for those resources at the time when we start to develop this our platform, we discovered that many of them were not available and then many of them were not usable.
It means that if we decided to integrate those resources into aerial work platform.

They do not have enough granular representation of nutritional information of foods and also about physical activities and this way it will not be possible to integrate this resource into a real world intelligent platform.
So due to this lack of knowledge into the domain we decided to develop a new resource by Inter.
Acting also with domain experts from the 20.

No local healthcare Department, so we already worked with them past project and also in this case we apply the methodology Ontology engineering guidance because we were already comfortable with this methodology in past experiences.
So we decided to propose it for this new task and basically what we what we did was a modeling exercise split in two main phases.

In the first one we collected from unstructured sources all and additional information about foods and also information about the physical activity, daily life, daily life activities and also information about the effort that is necessary for completing such activities.
Then by working with with the expert, we model the other three branches by integrating the concepts that were specifically thought for supporting the monitoring of people behavior.
In particular, monitoring the monitoring entity branch that includes all the concept that can be used for representing the guidelines that users should follow.
The user events that basically contains those concepts that are used for representing the data model of the data that are produced by users and stored in our knowledge.
And then at the temporal entity branch that was used for defining those entities that are used for telling to the original which are the data that has to be used for inferring purposes.
Concerning the food and nutrients branch, we started by analyzing the information containing the archive of Italian Minister of Agriculture and the epidemiological Department.
These documents were very useful for location of the issues because they contain for more than 1000 food, the very granular representation of the nutritional information of those food.
So from here we created a set of armor less 1000 food that we called basic food.
For which ambition information were represented at a very granular level.
However, these these individuals were not enough.
If we wanted to adopt this resource into a real world environment.
Because if a user has to provide what the heat in doing lunch, basically those food are two simple.
For for making an application usable.

From my bowl archives.
